intro: Asphodelus nervosus, commonly known as the narrow-leaf asphodel, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Europe and North Africa. It features linear, grass-like leaves that are often covered in a fine layer of white to yellowish hair. The plant produces tall, erect flowering stems topped with clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or dry habitats. Asphodelus nervosus is adapted to Mediterranean climates and is known for its resilience in arid conditions.
